name: Rico Baord
author: CountParadox
notes:
Designed primarily for Fn layer to be easy to remember while keeping full 104-equivalent functionality.

Top layer keys changed from default in blue:
* Esc/` changed to Esc only to allow key combinations that include shift.
* Backspace instead of Caps Lock stolen from Colemak layout. Still in standard location as old habits die hard and I relpase occasionally. Caps Lock now on Fn layer.
* I use Home and End for navigating and highlighting text more than Page Up/Down so made them default.

Fn Layer Notes:
* Extra set of Home/End and Page Up/Down on the arrow keys as I think it's intuitive placement. Testing which cluster gets more use.
* Insert just makes more sense on Delete than the default. Same with Page Up/Down and Home/End.
* Fn + Esc launches Task Manager in windows (Brogrammed as second Fn key hitting Ctrl + Shift + Esc)
* ESDF scrolling without moving left hand off homerow.
* YGHJ mouse movement by moving left hand over to homing bump. Left click on Enter, Right on Shift and Middle on \ are reasonable comfortable while holding Fn. (Only intended for occasional use at best)
* P = Play/Pause. Square brackets correspond to Back/Next. Square in line on O.
* L = Lighting. ; and ' cycle through LED modes.
* M = Mute. Angle Brackets correspond to Vollume Down/Up.
* C = Calculator
* N = Num Lock
* B = (Pause) Break
* V = Print Screen to keep in line with Num and Pause. Scroll lock on in top right as I actually use in on occasion and it's very quick to find.
* Menu just above Fn on ? because I use it frequently. May move to Top Layer above Right Arrow if I decide to stick with the arrow cluster for Home/End and Page Up/Down.
